sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: After months of relentless shelling, hundreds of Ukrainian fighters have been evacuated from the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The soldiers will be exchanged for Russian prisoners of war held by Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Local authorities in the self-declared Donetsk People's Republic in the east of Ukraine have stated that a group of severely injured soldiers have been evacuated

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: from the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol in exchange for Russian prisoners.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Earlier on Monday, the Russian government had stated that a deal had been struck and that the wounded would be taken to separatist territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian authorities, however, have yet to confirm that information.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Azovstal steel plant has become a symbol of Ukraine's war efforts to retain control of the port city of Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Thousands of people sought refuge there from the fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: of Mariupol. Thousands of people sought refuge there from the fighting. And earlier this month, all women, children and the elderly had been evacuated, but hundreds of soldiers remain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And the families of these soldiers have been pleading with the Turkish president, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, and with the Chinese leader, Xi Jinping, so that they join forces and try to negotiate a deal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: These families say these two nations are the only ones capable of convincing Moscow to let those soldiers out of the plant alive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: My colleague Natalia Lyubchenkova spoke to a partner of one of the soldiers about what life inside the Azov South Steel Plant is like. He is brave and he is strong. But I personally feel that he is tired now because they are out of medications out of food out of water. They don't have actual drinking water. It's technical water so the immune system yeah is not working good so and constant bomb shellings are influencing on his moral state but he never complains actually he never complains so basically he never tells me that he is not OK. He never tells me that he is tired. But I feel it's from the messages which I see. Meanwhile satellite images unveiled by the Ukrainian government show what appears to be a fourth mass grave near the city of Mariupol. The images depict two large trenches, one of which is over 30 meters long. Mariupol has seen the worst of the fighting and over the weekend, the last mass evacuation from the city took place. An aide to the mayor said that between 500 and a thousand cars with families left the city the largest such single operation since Russia's invasion on the 24th of February Annelies Bors is in Odessa southern Ukraine for Euronews no white smoke from the meeting of EU foreign affairs ministers in Brussels Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Hungary is still blocking the oil embargo against Russia, nearly two weeks after the European Commission presented a proposal to gradually cut the bloc's purchases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Budapest is asking for fresh EU funds to guarantee the construction of vital infrastructure, including new oil pipelines to compensate losses. Here the European Commission has caused a problem with the proposal so it's legitimate to expect Hungary and the Hungarian people to give a solution to finance investments and to compensate or prevent price increases, which would require a complete modernization of the Hungarian energy structure to the value of 15 to 18 billion euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: For Lithuania's foreign affairs minister, a solution is needed, as one country cannot keep the EU hostage over a ban on Russian oil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Hello, good morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: over a ban on Russian oil. Hello, good morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And now unfortunately we are, the whole Union is being held hostage by one member state who cannot help us find a consensus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The EU's Foreign Affairs Chief says the discussions with Hungary are now technical to understand how much money Budapest needs and how long it would take. οι συμφωνίες με την Ουγγαρία είναι τεχνικά, για να καταλάβουν πόσο χρήμα χρειάζεται η Βουδαπεστ και πόσο χρόνο θα χρειάζεται.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Αντίστοιχα, ο Ροζέ Μπορέλ εμπιστεύει ότι υπάρχει μια συγκοινή κατάσταση για το στόχο.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ένα πράγμα που είναι σαφό, ένα πράγμα που είναι σαφό για όλους στο Κύριο Κύριο, είναι ότι πρέπει να αφήσουμε την ενεργειακή ανάπτυξη της Ευρωπαϊκής Ένωσης με σχέση με το αερο, το γάσο και το χλιαρό που έρχονται από την Ρωσία. European Union with respect to oil, gas and coal coming from Russia. We have to get rid of this strong dependency that makes us very vulnerable. Another three member states particularly dependent on Russian fossil energy. Bulgaria, the Czech Republic and Slovakia are also demanding that the European Commission allows them to continue importing Russian energy beyond December 2024. But if Hungary says yes, they will accept the deal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine will once more dominate the meeting between the EU defence ministers today in

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Brussels. As the Ukrainian foreign Minister already said to his European counterparts yesterday, Ukraine needs more military support and it needs it faster. This is going to be described in more detail by the Ukrainian Defence Minister, who will also join the meeting. The EU already decided to provide another 500 million euros in financial support to Ukraine's military, bringing the total value of the bloc's overall military fund for the country to 2 billion euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The money is being provided via European Peace Facility and allows Ukraine to procure weapons and equipment for its ongoing fight against Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Besides, the Secretary-General of NATO, Jens Stoltenberg, is also going to join the ministers later today and they are certainly going to focus on Sweden's and Finland's decision to apply for NATO membership after decades of neutrality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Brussels more than welcomed the decision, with the EU Council President actually claiming that Sweden and Finland's decision to join NATO improves Europe's security. Ministers will certainly discuss timelines but also security guarantees in case of any hostile Russian reactions in the transition period. Efi Koutsakosta for Euronews Brussels. Brussels and Washington want to strengthen global supply chains in order to

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: counter the effects of Russia's war in Ukraine. The conflict has thrown the production and attainability of key components into chaos, worsening the cost of living crises on both sides of the Atlantic. For this reason, at the second meeting of the EU-US Trade and Technology Council in Paris this Monday, the two sides tried to present a united front in the face of Moscow's disruptive war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's clear that Russia's aggression against Ukraine is creating major disruptions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: creating major disruptions. So, well, it concerns, I would say, many goods across the board.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: First and foremost, it concerns energy, where we already have tangible cooperation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The availability of semiconductors, an essential component of electronic devices, is one product severely affected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's why Brussels and Washington want to develop an early warning system to identify any global disruptions to the production of semiconductors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And another goal, limiting Russia's access to advanced technology.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We were able to immediately come together and hammer Russia with extreme export controls and essentially cutting them off from advance all the advanced technology that they need to conduct their military operation it's not just Russia in their sights however China is also and as one of the world's largest semiconductor producers Brussels and Washington agreed to widen their supply chains for rare earth materials used to make the product. Pedro Sacadura, Euronews, Paris.
